I. Disassembly & Assembly Instructions for Flexible Replacement Parts
===========================================================================

1. Tool List
----------------

a. Flexible replacement part × 1
b. Small wrench / Electric screwdriver (M2 bit) × 1

   :alt: Data Acquisition Control Area
   :align: center
   :name: _hd-sensor_selection
   :class: preserve-aspect-ratio

2. Instructions for Replacing Flexible Replacement Parts
------------------------------------------------------------------

STEP 1: As shown in Figure 1, use a small wrench to unscrew the 2 M2 screws on the sensor sheet metal, then remove the sheet metal part.

.. figure:: ../images/step1.png
    :alt: Initial Software Setup
    :align: center
    :scale: 100%
    :name: _hd-step1
    :class: preserve-aspect-ratio 

    Figure 1

STEP 2: As shown in Figure 2, use a small wrench to gently pry open the buckle, then lift and remove the flexible replacement part.

.. figure:: ../images/step2.png
    :alt: Initial Software Setup
    :align: center
    :scale: 100%
    :name: _hd-step2
    :class: preserve-aspect-ratio 

    Figure 2

STEP 3: As shown in Figure 3, inspect the optical surface of the replacement part and the internal lens of the sensor. If there is dust, first use an air blower to remove the dust, then gently wipe with a dedicated lens cloth to avoid scratching the surface.

.. figure:: ../images/step3.png
    :alt: Initial Software Setup
    :align: center
    :scale: 100%
    :name: _hd-step3
    :class: preserve-aspect-ratio 

    Figure 3

STEP 4: As shown in Figure 4, install the new flexible replacement part. Strictly follow the order of Step 1 to Step 4; an incorrect order may cause permanent damage to the internal components of the sensor!

.. figure:: ../images/step4.png
    :alt: Initial Software Setup
    :align: center
    :scale: 100%
    :name: _hd-step4
    :class: preserve-aspect-ratio 

    Figure 4

STEP 5: As shown in Figure 5, install the sheet metal part and tighten the screws, following the reverse order of STEP 1.

.. figure:: ../images/step5.png
    :alt: Initial Software Setup
    :align: center
    :scale: 100%
    :name: _hd-step5
    :class: preserve-aspect-ratio 

    Figure 5
